title.narrative: SOCIAL SERVICES FOR VULNERABLE CHILDREN

description.narrative: Support services and measures targeting children living in families experiencing multiple deprivations and preventing separation are integrated into the social welfare system, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable children and their families are adequately supported so that their resilience to poverty and external shocks is increased and they live in a safe, non-violent family or family-like environment

participating-org.narrative: CENTAR ZA PORODICNI SMESTAJ I USVOJENJE NOVI SAD
FILOZOFSKI FAKULTET INST ZA PSIHOL UNIVERZITET U BEOGRADU

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Parent/caregiver education and programmes on violence, exploitation and abuse - across the life cycle
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Support to other social protection programs: Child care and early childhood development
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Support services and measures targeting children living in families experiencing multiple deprivations and preventing separationare integrated into the social welfare system

description.narrative: In support of government efforts in de-institutionalization and prevention of child and family separation, UNICEF supported knowledge generation to inform acceleration of ongoing reform processes towards increasing access to quality family support services and transformation of residential institutions and capacity-building aimed at expanding foster-care capacities. In parallel with upgrading evidence and relevance of advocacy for strengthening the social service workforce, support was provided to ensure continuity of quality child protection service delivery during the COVID-19 pandemic through setting innovative online information, knowledge and good-practice sharing platform. | Status:Met | As-of Date:14/12/2020

title.narrative: Improvement of framework for transformation of residential institutions (68325)

target.value: 2020:Centers for child and family conceptualized for scale-up

actual.value: 2020:Concept drafted, finalization postponed due to COVID and is pending endorsement of amendments to the law
